text: hi I'm just here cooking up eight slices
of bacon for a fantastic version of
pasta carbonara I don't know if you've
ever made carbonara before but it's
actually really really easy and a great
dish to make it home because it only
requires a few ingredients and most of
them are right from your pantry so cut
up some bacon into about half-inch
pieces you need eight two slices and
then crisp them up in a pan when they're
crisp you can drain them and some paper
towels is good and then you don't need
the fat for this recipe if you like to
save bacon fat and cook other things
like fried eggs and stuff like that in
bacon fat you should definitely save
this bacon fat on the back of my stove I
have a large pot of water boiling that's
for my pasta don't forget to add some
salt first you want a nice amount of
salt water should be salty like the sea
so I usually say at least a tablespoon
of coarse salt which seems like a lot
but you really need it to flavor your
pasta then add your pasta it's a pound
but jeez but good too and then you just
want to cook it till it's all dente once
the water comes back to a boil give the
pot a stir so that your pasta doesn't
stick together and then check it about I
would say a minute or even two minutes
before the Box says it's going to be
done you just never know
now while the pastas cooking you need to
get your sauce ready so over here I'll
show you what to do
SuperDuper easy three large eggs you're
going to whisk these in a really big
bowl because everything is going to get
tossed together in this bowl in a matter
of minutes you're going to have a
fantastic restaurant quality recipe then
you're going to be like why wasn't I
always making this at home before okay
so three eggs whisk them now a lot of
recipes stop here with the eggs and that
makes a nice creamy sauce for additional
creaminess you can add a half a cup of
half-and-half you could also use heavy
cream if you want to go totally crazy
and if you want a little bit of like
acidity to your recipe you can add a
touch of white wine and then 3/4 of a
cup of grated Parmesan cheese the
Bacon's gonna go into but I like to wait

ah you don't have to save any pasta
